ground_truth: REGGIE takes another cigarette from her pack, rips off the filter, and puts it into her mouth and points to the cigarette she just lit, still practically brand-new in the ashtray. She hands the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW, who sadly examines its mutilated end while REGGIE returns to the first cigarette. The WAITER returns with the coffee and onion soup. DYLE leaves the hotel and turns into the Place. A moment later, REGGIE comes cautiously from the hotel, first following DYLE, passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner. Then the SANDWICH-MAN and REGGIE follow. A moment later, DYLE passes a GIRL painting a canvas set up in the middle of the sidewalk, stops when he has passed her, and turns to look at her work. REGGIE, afraid she will be seen by DYLE, spins and sits at the sidewalk cafe's nearest table, her back to DYLE, which is already occupied by a middle-aged TOURIST, who looks up from his coffee, surprised. He stares at REGGIE, and she stares back. He smiles back emptily, not knowing what to make of her. REGGIE turns to look at DYLE, who has made his judgment of the painting and now moves on. The TOURIST finally finds the courage to speak, but as he opens his mouth, REGGIE, her eyes on DYLE, rises quickly from the table and leaves, leaving the TOURIST with his mouth open. He blinks, leaves some money on the table, and starts after her. REGGIE is following DYLE, and now the TOURIST follows her. She continues after DYLE, and the TOURIST hesitates but then continues following her. He goes to the curb, starts to step off, but finds the light against him and turns back in REGGIE's direction. Realizing she has to do something before DYLE spots her, she turns, takes the TOURIST's arm, and starts walking back to the cafe with him, leaving him standing there confused as she follows DYLE again. DYLE hops on the back of a bus as it pulls away. REGGIE hurries across the street, hailing a taxi. DYLE enters a building and walks to one of several windows with a sign over it. REGGIE then comes down the stairs but suddenly stops with a confused look on her face. As DYLE's turn comes, he addresses the CLERK who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops, pondering what to do. The camera moves across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE in the third one, on the phone.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes another cigarette from her pack, tears off the filter, and places it into her mouth and gestures to the cigarette she just ignited, still virtually brand-new in the ashtray. She passes the fresher one to BARTHOLOMEW, who gloomily inspects its mangled end while REGGIE returns to the initial cigarette. The WAITER returns with the coffee and onion soup. DYLE exits the hotel and turns into the Place. A moment later, REGGIE emerges cautiously from the hotel, initially trailing DYLE, passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner. Then the SANDWICH-MAN and REGGIE trail. A moment later, DYLE passes a GIRL painting a canvas set up in the center of the sidewalk, halts when he has passed her, and turns to gaze at her work. REGGIE, fearful she will be noticed by DYLE, spins and sits at the sidewalk cafe's nearest table, her back to DYLE, which is already occupied by a middle-aged TOURIST, who looks up from his coffee, astonished. He gazes at REGGIE, and she gazes back. He grins back vacantly, not knowing what to make of her. REGGIE turns to look at DYLE, who has made his assessment of the painting and now proceeds. The TOURIST finally finds the bravery to speak, but as he opens his mouth, REGGIE, her eyes on DYLE, rises swiftly from the table and departs, leaving the TOURIST with his mouth open. He blinks, leaves some currency on the table, and starts after her. REGGIE is trailing DYLE, and now the TOURIST trails her. She continues after DYLE, and the TOURIST hesitates but then continues trailing her. He goes to the curb, starts to step off, but finds the signal against him and turns back in REGGIE's direction. Realizing she must do something before DYLE spots her, she turns, takes the TOURIST's arm, and starts walking back to the cafe with him, leaving him standing there bewildered as she follows DYLE again. DYLE hops on the back of a bus as it pulls away. REGGIE hastens across the street, hailing a taxi. DYLE enters a building and walks to one of several windows with a sign over it. REGGIE then descends the stairs but suddenly halts with a perplexed look on her face. As DYLE's turn comes, he addresses the CLERK who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops, contemplating what to do. The camera shifts across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE in the third one, on the phone.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Another cigarette is taken from her pack by REGGIE, the filter is ripped off, and it is put into her mouth. She points to the cigarette that was just lit by her, still practically brand-new in the ashtray. The newer one is handed by her to BARTHOLOMEW, who sadly examines its mutilated end while the first cigarette is returned to by REGGIE. The coffee and onion soup are brought back by the WAITER. The hotel is left by DYLE, who turns into the Place. A moment later, the hotel is cautiously exited by REGGIE, who first follows DYLE, passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner. Then, the SANDWICH-MAN and REGGIE are followed. A moment later, a GIRL painting a canvas set up in the middle of the sidewalk is passed by DYLE, who stops when he has passed her, and turns to look at her work. Afraid she will be seen by DYLE, REGGIE spins and sits at the sidewalk cafe's nearest table, her back to DYLE, which is already occupied by a middle-aged TOURIST, who looks up from his coffee, surprised. REGGIE is stared at by him, and she stares back. An empty smile is given by him, not knowing what to make of her. REGGIE turns to look at DYLE, his judgment of the painting already made by now, and he moves on. The courage to speak is finally found by the TOURIST, but as his mouth is opened, REGGIE, her eyes on DYLE, rises quickly from the table and leaves, leaving the TOURIST with his mouth open. He blinks, leaves some money on the table, and starts after her. DYLE is followed by REGGIE, and she is now followed by the TOURIST. After DYLE, she continues, and the TOURIST hesitates but then continues following her. To the curb, he goes, starts to step off, but finds the light against him and turns back in REGGIE's direction. Realizing something must be done before DYLE spots her, she turns, takes the TOURIST's arm, and starts walking back to the cafe with him, leaving him standing there confused as she follows DYLE again. The back of a bus is hopped on by DYLE as it pulls away. Across the street, REGGIE hurries, hailing a taxi. A building is entered by DYLE, who walks to one of several windows with a sign over it. Down the stairs, REGGIE then comes but suddenly stops with a confused look on her face. As DYLE's turn comes, the CLERK is addressed by him, who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops, pondering what to do. Across an empty cabin, the camera moves to discover REGGIE in the third one, on the phone.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes a cigarette from her pack, removes the filter, and puts it in her mouth, pointing to the nearly new one in the ashtray. She gives the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW, who examines its damaged end while REGGIE returns to the first cigarette. The WAITER brings coffee and onion soup. DYLE leaves the hotel and heads to the Place, with REGGIE cautiously following him, passing a sidewalk cafe. DYLE passes a GIRL painting on the sidewalk, stops to look at her work, then moves on. Afraid of being seen, REGGIE sits at a table with a middle-aged TOURIST, who stares at her, surprised. REGGIE watches DYLE, and when he leaves, she quickly departs, leaving the TOURIST stunned. The TOURIST follows REGGIE, who is trailing DYLE. Hesitant, the TOURIST hesitates before continuing. As REGGIE realizes she must act before DYLE sees her, she grabs the TOURIST's arm and walks him back to the cafe, leaving him confused as she resumes following DYLE. DYLE hops on a bus, while REGGIE hails a taxi. DYLE enters a building and approaches a window with a sign overhead. REGGIE comes down the stairs but stops, confused. As DYLE's turn arrives, he speaks to the CLERK, who sorts through letters. DYLE pauses, contemplating, while the camera reveals REGGIE on the phone in the third cabin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes a cigarette, removes the filter, and puts it in her mouth, gesturing to the lit one in the ashtray. She gives the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW, who inspects it as REGGIE returns to her first cigarette. The WAITER serves the coffee and onion soup. DYLE exits the hotel, entering the Place. Shortly, REGGIE cautiously follows him, passing a cafe. The SANDWICH-MAN joins, and DYLE notices a GIRL painting on the sidewalk, stopping to examine her work. REGGIE, trying to avoid detection, sits at a cafe table opposite a TOURIST, who stares in surprise. DYLE, uninterested in the painting, moves on. As the TOURIST attempts to speak, REGGIE rises, focused on DYLE, leaving the TOURIST speechless. He pays and follows her. She trails DYLE, and the TOURIST follows her. He hesitates at the curb but then follows again. REGGIE, needing a diversion, takes the TOURIST's arm and heads back to the cafe, leaving him confused as she resumes following DYLE. DYLE boards a bus. REGGIE hails a taxi and follows him. DYLE enters a building and approaches a window with a sign. REGGIE follows, stopping with a puzzled look. DYLE speaks to a CLERK sorting letters. The camera moves to REGGIE in a cabin, on the phone.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
REGGIE, with a deliberate, practiced motion, retrieves yet another cigarette from her well-worn pack. She swiftly tears off the filter and places it deliberately between her lips. Her attention then shifts to the cigarette she had just lit moments before, still nearly fresh and untouched as it rests in the ashtray. With a slight gesture, she hands the newer cigarette to BARTHOLOMEW, who looks down at its damaged end with a sorrowful expression, while REGGIE redirects her focus back to the first cigarette.

At this juncture, the WAITER returns, carefully balancing a tray with fragrant coffee and a steaming bowl of onion soup. Meanwhile, DYLE exits the hotel and makes his way toward the Place. Only a few moments later, REGGIE emerges cautiously from the hotel entrance. Her eyes are fixed on DYLE as she begins to follow him, passing by a lively sidewalk café that sits invitingly at the corner. Soon after, the SANDWICH-MAN joins this subtle procession behind REGGIE.

As DYLE passes by a GIRL engrossed in painting a canvas positioned in the center of the sidewalk, he pauses, intrigued by her artwork, and turns back to evaluate it. Conscious of being noticed by DYLE, REGGIE reacts quickly, spinning around to settle into the nearest available seat at the sidewalk café. Unfortunately, this seat is already occupied by a bewildered middle-aged TOURIST, who looks up from his coffee, surprise etched on his face. Their eyes meet, and although he offers a vacant smile, he remains unsure of the situation. REGGIE soon shifts her gaze back to DYLE, who, after considering the painting, resumes his walk.

The TOURIST, summoning some courage, opens his mouth to speak, but before he can utter a word, REGGIE, her eyes fixated on DYLE, abruptly rises from the table and departs, leaving the TOURIST momentarily stunned and his mouth agape. After blinking in surprise, he places some money on the table and decides to pursue her. REGGIE continues to trail DYLE, with the TOURIST now trailing her. Though the TOURIST momentarily hesitates, he ultimately resolves to continue following her. Upon reaching the curb, he attempts to step off, only to be stopped by the pedestrian light against him, prompting him to turn back in REGGIE's direction.

Sensing the urgent need to remain undetected by DYLE, REGGIE swiftly turns, grasps the TOURIST's arm with determination, and begins walking back toward the café with him, leaving the TOURIST puzzled and standing there as she resumes her pursuit of DYLE. Just as DYLE hops onto the back of a moving bus, REGGIE quickly strides across the street and signals for a taxi.

DYLE enters a building and approaches one of the several windows marked with a sign overhead. Meanwhile, REGGIE descends the stairs but comes to an abrupt halt, bewilderment evident on her face. As it becomes DYLE's turn, he engages with the CLERK, who retrieves a bundle of letters and meticulously sorts through them. DYLE pauses, contemplating his next move. In a swift camera transition across an unoccupied cabin, REGGIE is revealed in the third one, speaking into a phone.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
REGGIE, with a deliberate and practiced motion honed over time, retrieves yet another cigarette from her worn and familiar pack. She swiftly tears off the filter with a focused intent, placing it deliberately between her lips. Her attention momentarily shifts back to the cigarette she had just lit only moments before, which remains nearly fresh and untouched as it quietly rests in the ashtray. With a slight and casual gesture, she hands the newer cigarette to BARTHOLOMEW, who looks down at its damaged end with a sorrowful and contemplative expression, while REGGIE redirects her focus back to the first cigarette resting in front of her.

At this particular juncture, the WAITER returns, carefully balancing a tray laden with fragrant and aromatic coffee alongside a steaming hot bowl of onion soup. Meanwhile, DYLE exits the hotel and begins to make his way toward the vibrant Place. Only a few moments later, REGGIE emerges cautiously and deliberately from the hotel entrance. Her eyes are fixed intently on DYLE as she begins to follow him, passing by a lively and inviting sidewalk café that sits pleasantly at the corner. Soon after, the SANDWICH-MAN joins this subtle and quiet procession behind REGGIE.

As DYLE passes by a GIRL, deeply engrossed in painting a canvas positioned in the center of the busy sidewalk, he pauses, visibly intrigued by her artwork, and turns back to evaluate it with interest. Conscious of being noticed by DYLE, REGGIE reacts quickly and instinctively, spinning around to settle hurriedly into the nearest available seat at the sidewalk café. Unfortunately, this particular seat is already occupied by a bewildered and confused middle-aged TOURIST, who looks up from his coffee, surprise etched deeply on his face. Their eyes meet, and although he offers a vacant and uncertain smile, he remains unsure of the situation unfolding around him. REGGIE soon shifts her gaze back to DYLE, who, after considering the painting thoughtfully, resumes his walk.

The TOURIST, summoning some newfound courage, opens his mouth to speak, but before he can utter even a single word, REGGIE, her eyes remaining fixated intently on DYLE, abruptly rises from the table and departs with urgency, leaving the TOURIST momentarily stunned and his mouth agape in surprise. After blinking in disbelief, he places some money on the table and decides to pursue her with newfound determination. REGGIE continues to trail DYLE, with the TOURIST now trailing her movements. Though the TOURIST momentarily hesitates, he ultimately resolves to continue following her. Upon reaching the curb, he attempts to step off, only to be stopped by the pedestrian light against him, prompting him to turn back in REGGIE's direction with frustration.

Sensing the urgent need to remain undetected by DYLE, REGGIE swiftly turns, grasps the TOURIST's arm with determination and urgency, and begins walking back toward the café with him, leaving the TOURIST puzzled and standing there as she resumes her pursuit of DYLE. Just as DYLE hops onto the back of a moving bus, REGGIE quickly strides across the street and signals for a waiting taxi.

DYLE enters a nondescript building and approaches one of the several windows marked with a sign overhead. Meanwhile, REGGIE descends the stairs but comes to an abrupt halt, bewilderment clearly evident on her face. As it becomes DYLE's turn in line, he engages with the CLERK, who retrieves a bundle of letters and meticulously sorts through them with practiced ease. DYLE pauses, contemplating his next move with careful consideration. In a swift and smooth camera transition across an unoccupied cabin, REGGIE is revealed in the third one, speaking intently into a phone.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Reggie carefully slides another cigarette from her pack, tears the filter off with a quick motion, and places it between her lips, indicating the still new cigarette resting in the ashtray as she does so. She extends her hand, passing the fresher cigarette to Bartholomew, who looks down at its torn end with a sense of melancholy, while Reggie shifts her attention back to the original cigarette she had lit. The waiter returns to their table, bringing with him the coffee and onion soup, setting the scene further. Meanwhile, Dyle exits the hotel with purposeful steps, turning into the bustling Place. Shortly after, Reggie emerges from the hotel, moving with caution as she follows Dyle, her path taking her past a corner sidewalk cafe. The sandwich-man joins Reggie in her pursuit. Dyle proceeds down the street, passing a girl engrossed in painting on a canvas set up in the middle of the sidewalk. He takes a few more steps, pauses, and turns to appraise her artwork. Fearing detection by Dyle, Reggie swiftly pivots around and takes a seat at the sidewalk cafe's nearest available table, which happens to be occupied by a middle-aged tourist. The tourist, caught off guard, looks up from his coffee in surprise, locking eyes with Reggie. As their gazes meet, he offers a vacant smile, unsure of how to interpret the situation. Reggie glances back towards Dyle, who, having scrutinized the painting, decides to continue on his way. Just as the tourist musters the courage to speak, Reggie, eyes fixed on Dyle, abruptly stands from the table and departs, leaving the tourist with his mouth agape. The tourist blinks, places some money on the table, and starts after her. Reggie resumes her pursuit of Dyle, with the tourist now trailing her steps. As Dyle walks ahead, the tourist momentarily hesitates before committing to follow Reggie once more. Upon reaching the curb, he attempts to step off but notices the light is against him and turns back toward Reggie. Realizing she must act before Dyle notices her, Reggie turns and decisively takes the tourist's arm, guiding him back towards the cafe, only to release him abruptly, leaving him bewildered, as she resumes her pursuit of Dyle. Observing Dyle as he hops onto the back of a departing bus, Reggie quickly navigates across the street, waving down a taxi. Dyle arrives at a building and approaches a window beneath a sign, seemingly intent on a task. Reggie comes down the stairs into the building but halts abruptly, her expression a mix of uncertainty and surprise. As Dyle's turn at the window arrives, he begins to address the clerk, who retrieves a bundle of letters and begins sorting through them. Dyle pauses, contemplating his next move. Meanwhile, the camera shifts across an empty cabin to reveal Reggie seated in the third one, engaged in a phone call.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes a cigarette, removes the filter, and then gestures to another nearly new one in the ashtray before handing the altered cigarette to BARTHOLOMEW, who examines it sadly. As she returns to smoking the first cigarette, the WAITER brings coffee and onion soup. Nearby, DYLE exits the hotel and heads into the Place, followed cautiously by REGGIE. Passing a sidewalk cafe, she mirrors DYLE’s route, eventually trailing behind him. When DYLE pauses to observe a GIRL painting on the sidewalk, REGGIE quickly sits at a cafe table, now wary of being noticed. This table is occupied by a TOURIST, who is surprised by her presence. They exchange a brief, perplexed glance before REGGIE checks on DYLE, who moves on after examining the painting. As the TOURIST attempts to speak, REGGIE quickly stands, trailing DYLE once more, leaving the TOURIST baffled. Undeterred, he follows her across the street, hesitating only briefly before continuing the pursuit. Upon realizing her need to remain unseen, REGGIE turns back, grasps the TOURIST's arm, and pretends to walk with him before leaving him confused as she resumes following DYLE. As DYLE hops onto a departing bus, REGGIE hastily hails a taxi and follows him. DYLE enters a building and approaches a window, contemplating his next move as a CLERK sorts through a bundle of letters. Meanwhile, the camera reveals REGGIE on the phone in an empty cabin, exhibiting a puzzled expression.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Reggie, known for her peculiar habit of removing cigarette filters—a practice originating from a time when unfiltered cigarettes were more common and believed by some to offer a stronger taste—takes another cigarette from her pack and puts it into her mouth, pointing to the cigarette she just lit, still practically brand-new in the ashtray. She hands the newer one to Bartholomew, who sadly examines its mutilated end, a sign of Reggie's unique smoking ritual, while she returns to the first cigarette. The waiter, a seasoned employee familiar with the daily hustle of this bustling Parisian district, returns with the coffee and onion soup, a traditional French dish known for its rich, savory flavor. Dyle leaves the hotel, a historic establishment renowned for its art deco architecture, and turns into the Place, an open square often filled with locals and tourists alike. A moment later, Reggie cautiously emerges from the hotel, first following Dyle, passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner, one of many that line the streets of this vibrant Paris neighborhood. Then the sandwich-man, a common fixture in the area promoting local eateries, and Reggie follow. A moment later, Dyle passes a girl painting a canvas set up in the middle of the sidewalk, a scene reminiscent of the city's rich tradition of street artists who capture the daily life of Paris, stops when he has passed her, and turns to look at her work. Reggie, afraid she will be seen by Dyle, spins and sits at the sidewalk cafe's nearest table, her back to Dyle, which is already occupied by a middle-aged tourist, who looks up from his coffee, surprised by the sudden company. He stares at Reggie, and she stares back. He smiles back emptily, not knowing what to make of her sudden presence. Reggie turns to look at Dyle, who has made his judgment of the painting, appreciating its impressionistic style typical of the area, and now moves on. The tourist finally finds the courage to speak, but as he opens his mouth, Reggie, her eyes on Dyle, rises quickly from the table and leaves, leaving the tourist with his mouth open, unsure of what just transpired. He blinks, leaves some money on the table, and starts after her in a bid to understand the mystery. Reggie is following Dyle, and now the tourist follows her intrigued by the unfolding drama. She continues after Dyle, and the tourist hesitates but then continues following her, caught in the intrigue. He goes to the curb, starts to step off, but finds the light against him, a common spectacle with Paris's notoriously busy traffic, and turns back in Reggie's direction. Realizing she has to do something before Dyle spots her, she turns, takes the tourist's arm, and starts walking back to the cafe with him, leaving him standing there confused as she follows Dyle again. Dyle hops on the back of a bus as it pulls away, a popular mode of transport among locals for short distances. Reggie hurries across the street, hailing one of the city's characteristic yellow taxis. Dyle enters a building and walks to one of several windows with a sign over it indicating it might be a post office or bank, a place often filled with people conducting their daily business. Reggie then comes down the stairs but suddenly stops with a confused look on her face, perhaps questioning her course of action. As Dyle's turn comes, he addresses the clerk who takes out a bundle of letters, remnants of an era when communication largely relied on postal services, and sorts through it. Dyle stops, pondering what to do. The camera moves across an empty cabin to discover Reggie in the third one, on the phone, possibly planning her next move in the unfolding chase.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. He blinks leaves some money on the table and starts after her. REGGIE is following DYLE and now the TOURIST follows her. She continues after DYLE and the TOURIST hesitates but then continues following her. He goes to the curb starts to step off but finds the light against him and turns back in REGGIE's direction. Realizing she has to do something before DYLE spots her. she turns takes the TOURIST's arm and starts walking back to the cafe with him leaving him standing there confused as she follows DYLE again. DYLE hops on the back of a bus as it pulls away. REGGIE hurries across the street hailing a taxi. DYLE enters a building and walks to one of several windows with a sign over it. REGGIE then comes down the stairs but suddenly stops with a confused look on her face. As DYLE's turn comes he addresses the CLERK who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops pondering what to do. The camera moves across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE in the third one on the phone.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes another cigarette from her pack rips off the filter and puts it into her mouth and points to the cigarette she just lit still practically brandnew in the ashtray. She hands the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW who sadly examines its mutilated end while REGGIE returns to the first cigarette. The WAITER returns with the coffee and onion soup. DYLE leaves the hotel and turns into the Place. A moment later REGGIE comes cautiously from the hotel first following DYLE passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner. Then the SANDWICHMAN and REGGIE follow. A moment later DYLE passes a GIRL painting a canvas set up in the middle of the sidewalk stops when he has passed her and turns to look at her work. REGGIE hurries across the street hailing a taxi. DYLE enters a building and walks to one of several windows with a sign over it. REGGIE then comes down the stairs but suddenly stops with a confused look on her face. As DYLE's turn comes he addresses the CLERK who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops pondering what to do. The camera moves across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE in the third one on the phone.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes another cigarette from her pack rips off the filter and puts it into her mouth and points to the cigarette she just lit still practically brandnew in the ashtray. She hands the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW who sadly examines its mutilated end while REGGIE returns to the first cigarette. The WAITER returns with the coffee and onion soup. As DYLE's turn comes he addresses the CLERK who takes out a bundle of letters and sorts through it. DYLE stops pondering what to do. The camera moves across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE in the third one on the phone.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: BLANCA grabs another lollipop from her bag, tears off the wrapper, and slips it into her pocket and gestures to the lollipop she just unwrapped, still nearly untouched in the candy bowl. She hands the fresher one to PERCIVAL, who cheerfully examines its sticky end while BLANCA returns to the first lollipop. The LIBRARIAN arrives with the tea and apple pie. FINN departs the cabin and strolls into the Garden. A moment later, BLANCA comes stealthily from the cabin, initially trailing FINN, passing a roadside bookstore on the corner. Then the MAILMAN and BLANCA trail behind. A moment later, FINN passes a BOY sculpting a statue set up in the middle of the road, pauses when he has passed him, and turns to observe his creation. BLANCA, scared she will catch FINN's attention, twirls and lands at the bookstore's closest table, her back to FINN, which is already occupied by an elderly EXPLORER, who glances up from his tea, startled. He gazes at BLANCA, and she gazes back. He grins back vacantly, unsure of how to perceive her. BLANCA turns to peek at FINN, who has assessed the sculpture and now continues onward. The EXPLORER ultimately musters the bravery to speak, but as he opens his lips, BLANCA, her focus on FINN, stands abruptly from the table and departs, leaving the EXPLORER with his mouth ajar. He squints, places some coins on the table, and starts after her. BLANCA is tailing FINN, and now the EXPLORER trails her. She proceeds after FINN, and the EXPLORER wavers but then continues tailing her. He approaches the curb, begins to step off, but notices the light is red and turns back in BLANCA's direction. Realizing she must act before FINN notices her, she turns, grabs the EXPLORER's shoulder, and starts walking back to the bookstore with him, leaving him standing there bewildered as she trails FINN again. FINN hops on the back of a tram as it departs. BLANCA rushes across the square, signaling a carriage. FINN enters a cottage and strides to one of several booths with a plaque above it. BLANCA then descends the ladder but suddenly halts with a bewildered expression. As FINN's turn comes, he speaks to the RECEPTIONIST who pulls out a stack of postcards and shuffles through it. FINN pauses, contemplating his next step. The camera pans across an empty van to reveal BLANCA in the third one, on the phone.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: REGGIE takes a cigarette, rips off the filter, and puts it in her mouth, handing another to BARTHOLOMEW. The WAITER serves coffee and onion soup. DYLE exits the hotel, followed by REGGIE. As he passes a GIRL painting on the sidewalk, REGGIE cautiously sits at a cafe table with a TOURIST, avoiding DYLE's gaze. The TOURIST is confused when REGGIE suddenly leaves to follow DYLE, who hops on a bus. The TOURIST starts to follow REGGIE but hesitates at the curb. REGGIE takes his arm to deter DYLE, then quickly resumes her pursuit. She hails a taxi as DYLE enters a building. Inside, DYLE addresses a CLERK sorting through letters. REGGIE, on the phone in a nearby cabin, looks confused as she decides her next move.
